If \\( h(z) \\) is applied to a complex number \\( z_0 \\) at t = 0 and then allowed to evolve under \\( \\dot{x} = Mx \\) and \\( \\dot{y} = Ny \\) without further intervention, will \\( z(t) \\) at t = T be the same as if \\( z_0 \\) was directly evolved to t = T under \\( \\dot{x} = Mx \\) and \\( \\dot{y} = Ny \\)?
Explanation: The application of \\( h(z) \\) not only affects the initial condition but also modifies how \\( z \\) evolves by introducing a rotation dependent on K.
